result.execSummary:
The defendant Carla M. Patti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The $150 cash bond on file was applie.  The balance of the fine and costs are to be paid as follows:  $10 is due on or before 12-1-16 and then by the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carla M. Patti

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Sgt Brown - a DNA sample has been taken
Emailed Sgt. Brown to see if she submitted her DNA sample.

Defendant appears in person with counsel SPD Ann Terrien.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Victim received proper notification and is not present.  Court prints copy of VIS to SPD Terrien.  Will plea to Count 1 with Count 2 - DRI.  Court reviews charge and potential penalties.  She states she understands and pleads No Contest to Count 1.  Court performs plea/waiver or rights colloquy including reviewing elements of the charge.  Defense stipulates to factual basis in the complaint.  Courts finds she freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently enters her plea, waives her rights, and the Court accepts the plea; finds guilty.  Count 2 is DRI.  ADA Melissa Inlow states there is a joint recommendation for a fine of $50 plus costs.  SPD Terrien makes statement to the Court on behalf of her client.  She is requesting a $10 per month payment plan due to financial hardship.  Defendant does not make any statement to the Court.  Court adopts the joint recommendation and imposes a fine of $ 50  plus costs including the domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge.  To be paid at $10 per month payment plan effective 12-1-16 with failure to pay 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Must provide DNA sample.  Given DNA submission form.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Terrien appeared on behalf of the defendant. Resolved.   Plea/sentencing scheduled.
Status conference on October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Terrien.   Requesting one more STC.  Set for 10/17 at 3 pm.

Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Terrien.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC 9/7 and STC 9/26 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  the victim:  R.S.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  the victim:  R.S.

Special Prosecutor, Rebecca Maki-Wallender appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel. Defendant did not receive the complaint.  Copy given to the defendant in court.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  She understood.  Court explained her attorney options.  Defendant will contact SPD.  AIA set for 8/15/16 at 9 am.
